intro: Barroetea subuligera var. latisquama, commonly known as the broad-scale barroetea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its subulate (awl-shaped) leaves that are broader at the base, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
